data.title: Bahe Cook Cantley & Nefzger
data.meta_description: John Doyle has been practicing in Kentucky for over a decade. He has tried many jury trials and handled numerous multi-million dollar injury claims.
data.text:
Louisville Personal Injury Attorney

John Doyle has been an attorney in Kentucky for more than a decade. He has tried many jury trials in Jefferson County and in other parts of the state and handled numerous multi-million dollar injury claims. In fact, John is a member of the prestigious Million Dollar Advocates Forum, one of the most prestigious groups of trial attorneys in the United States. Membership is limited to lawyers who have won million and multi-million dollar verdicts and settlements. Fewer than 1% of U.S. lawyers are members.

BACKGROUND

John graduated from the Louis D. Brandeis School of Law at the University of Louisville as a Juris Doctor (JD). He was a member of the Brandeis Law Journal, Moot Court Board, and Book Award recipient. He also attended the University of Louisville on a full-academic scholarship and graduated cum laude with a Bachelor of Science in Business Management. He was a member of numerous scholar societies and the University Track and Cross-Country teams. John is an Eagle Scout, a graduate of the Louisville Bar Association Leadership Academy, a member of the Kentucky Justice Association, Kentucky Bar Association, American Justice Association, Louisville Bar Association, and the Kentucky Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers. John previously worked with Jones Ward, PLC, Maury D. Kommor & Associates, PLLC, the Louisville-Jefferson Co. Public Defenderâ€™s Office, and clerked for the Kentucky Court of Appeals and an insurance defense firm. He focuses his practice primarily on personal injury litigation, including wrongful death, serious automobile, truck and semi-truck injury cases, slip and falls, insurance coverage disputes, work place injury, nursing home and hospital liability, dog-bites, and professional negligence. He also maintains a significant criminal defense practice and handles probate/estate planning.

EDUCATION

Juris Doctor, Louis D. Brandeis School of Law

Louisville Bar Association Leadership Academy

Bachelor of Science in Business Management, University of Louisville

Cum laude

PUBLISHED CASES

Franklin v. Safe Auto Ins. Co., Ky. App., 290 S.W.3d 69 (2009).
